meanings.sent1: In our town, the judicature ensures that everyone is treated fairly in court.
meanings.sent2: The judicature plays a crucial role in upholding the law and ensuring justice is served.
meanings.sent3: The judicature must have a lot of work to do with all the cases coming in.
meanings.sent4: She saw the judicature as a shield protecting the rights of the people.
meanings.sent5: The judicature stands as a beacon of fairness and equality in our society.

meanings.sent1: The judicature in our city is known for its efficiency and fairness.
meanings.sent2: When you have a legal issue, you can seek help from the judicature.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I would end up in front of the judicature, but here I am.
meanings.sent4: The judicature is like a referee in the game of justice.
meanings.sent5: People trust the judicature to resolve disputes and uphold the law.

meanings.definition: The office or function of a judge.
meanings.sent1: Her dream is to hold a position in the judicature and make a difference.
meanings.sent2: The judicature requires individuals with integrity and a strong sense of justice.
meanings.sent3: Being part of the judicature means upholding the law and ensuring fairness.
meanings.sent4: He saw the judicature as a platform to bring about positive change.
meanings.sent5: Working in the judicature allows one to contribute to a just society.
